channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The biggest part of the U.S. economy cools off. So does inflation.
ADP report shows labor market is in pretty good shape
Why Trump’s sovereign-wealth fund won’t Make America Great Again
Tesla sales are diving in Germany and across Europe too
Novo Nordisk missed its diversity targets last year, and its CEO paid a financial price
item.description: Novo Nordisk's CEO took a $1.5 million pay cut in 2024 as the pharma giant's share price tanked and it missed profit and DEI targets.

item.title: Patients will pay more for prescription meds and face drug shortages amid Trump tariffs, pharma groups warn
item.description: China, one of the countries affected by the new tariffs, is the world’s largest producer of active pharmaceutical ingredients.

item.title: Amid a global loss of trust, institutions must prove their value, says Edelman’s CEO
item.description: What institutions do Americans trust the most? Businesses, according to the latest Edelman Trust Barometer.

item.title: Disney posts a big profit beat amid strength in sports and experiences
Elon Musk says he will be irreparably harmed if OpenAI isn’t stopped. The federal judge overseeing his lawsuit called it a ‘stretch’
item.description: At the heart of the dispute is a 2017 internal power struggle at the fledgling startup that led to Altman becoming OpenAI’s CEO.

item.title: Farewell, quiet quitting. 2025 could be the year of ‘revenge quitting’
item.description: Worker dissatisfaction could lead to a revolt.
